<Link id="l00024" /><CodeLine lineNumber="24"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00025" /><CodeLine lineNumber="25"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Twine - A lightweight data structure for efficiently representing the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00026" /><CodeLine lineNumber="26"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// concatenation of temporary values as strings.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00027" /><CodeLine lineNumber="27"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00028" /><CodeLine lineNumber="28"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// A Twine is a kind of rope, it represents a concatenated string using a</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00029" /><CodeLine lineNumber="29"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// binary-tree, where the string is the preorder of the nodes. Since the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00030" /><CodeLine lineNumber="30"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Twine can be efficiently rendered into a buffer when its result is used,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00031" /><CodeLine lineNumber="31"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// it avoids the cost of generating temporary values for intermediate string</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00032" /><CodeLine lineNumber="32"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// results -- particularly in cases when the Twine result is never</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00033" /><CodeLine lineNumber="33"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// required. By explicitly tracking the type of leaf nodes, we can also avoid</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00034" /><CodeLine lineNumber="34"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// the creation of temporary strings for conversions operations (such as</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00035" /><CodeLine lineNumber="35"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// appending an integer to a string).</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00036" /><CodeLine lineNumber="36"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00037" /><CodeLine lineNumber="37"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// A Twine is not intended for use directly and should not be stored, its</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00038" /><CodeLine lineNumber="38"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// implementation relies on the ability to store pointers to temporary stack</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00039" /><CodeLine lineNumber="39"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// objects which may be deallocated at the end of a statement. Twines should</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00040" /><CodeLine lineNumber="40"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// only be used as const references in arguments, when an API wishes</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00041" /><CodeLine lineNumber="41"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// to accept possibly-concatenated strings.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00042" /><CodeLine lineNumber="42"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00043" /><CodeLine lineNumber="43"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Twines support a special &#39;null&#39; value, which always concatenates to form</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00044" /><CodeLine lineNumber="44"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// itself, and renders as an empty string. This can be returned from APIs to</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00045" /><CodeLine lineNumber="45"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// effectively nullify any concatenations performed on the result.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00046" /><CodeLine lineNumber="46"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00047" /><CodeLine lineNumber="47"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// \\b Implementation</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00048" /><CodeLine lineNumber="48"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00049" /><CodeLine lineNumber="49"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Given the nature of a Twine, it is not possible for the Twine&#39;s</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00050" /><CodeLine lineNumber="50"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// concatenation method to construct interior nodes; the result must be</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00051" /><CodeLine lineNumber="51"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// represented inside the returned value. For this reason a Twine object</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00052" /><CodeLine lineNumber="52"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// actually holds two values, the left- and right-hand sides of a</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00053" /><CodeLine lineNumber="53"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// concatenation. We also have nullary Twine objects, which are effectively</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00054" /><CodeLine lineNumber="54"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// sentinel values that represent empty strings.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00055" /><CodeLine lineNumber="55"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00056" /><CodeLine lineNumber="56"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Thus, a Twine can effectively have zero, one, or two children. The \\see</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00057" /><CodeLine lineNumber="57"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// isNullary(), \\see isUnary(), and \\see isBinary() predicates exist for</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00058" /><CodeLine lineNumber="58"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// testing the number of children.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00059" /><CodeLine lineNumber="59"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00060" /><CodeLine lineNumber="60"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// We maintain a number of invariants on Twine objects (FIXME: Why):</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00061" /><CodeLine lineNumber="61"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///  - Nullary twines are always represented with their Kind on the left-hand</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00062" /><CodeLine lineNumber="62"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///    side, and the Empty kind on the right-hand side.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00063" /><CodeLine lineNumber="63"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///  - Unary twines are always represented with the value on the left-hand</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00064" /><CodeLine lineNumber="64"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///    side, and the Empty kind on the right-hand side.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00065" /><CodeLine lineNumber="65"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///  - If a Twine has another Twine as a child, that child should always be</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00066" /><CodeLine lineNumber="66"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///    binary (otherwise it could have been folded into the parent).</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00067" /><CodeLine lineNumber="67"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00068" /><CodeLine lineNumber="68"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// These invariants are check by \\see isValid().</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00069" /><CodeLine lineNumber="69"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00070" /><CodeLine lineNumber="70"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// \\b Efficiency Considerations</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00071" /><CodeLine lineNumber="71"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00072" /><CodeLine lineNumber="72"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// The Twine is designed to yield efficient and small code for common</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00073" /><CodeLine lineNumber="73"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// situations. For this reason, the concat() method is inlined so that</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00074" /><CodeLine lineNumber="74"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// concatenations of leaf nodes can be optimized into stores directly into a</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00075" /><CodeLine lineNumber="75"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// single stack allocated object.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00076" /><CodeLine lineNumber="76"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00077" /><CodeLine lineNumber="77"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// In practice, not all compilers can be trusted to optimize concat() fully,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00078" /><CodeLine lineNumber="78"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// so we provide two additional methods (and accompanying operator+</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00079" /><CodeLine lineNumber="79"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// overloads) to guarantee that particularly important cases (cstring plus</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00080" /><CodeLine lineNumber="80"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// StringRef) codegen as desired.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00081" /><CodeLine lineNumber="81" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/twine"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">class </Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">Twine &#123;</Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00082" /><CodeLine lineNumber="82"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// NodeKind - Represent the type of an argument.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00083" /><CodeLine lineNumber="83"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">enum</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> NodeKind : </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">unsigned</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">char</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> &#123;</Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00084" /><CodeLine lineNumber="84"><Highlight kind="comment">      /// An empty string; the result of concatenating anything with it is also</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00085" /><CodeLine lineNumber="85"><Highlight kind="comment">      /// empty.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00086" /><CodeLine lineNumber="86"><Highlight kind="normal">      NullKind,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00087" /><CodeLine lineNumber="87"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00088" /><CodeLine lineNumber="88"><Highlight kind="comment">      /// The empty string.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00089" /><CodeLine lineNumber="89"><Highlight kind="normal">      EmptyKind,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00090" /><CodeLine lineNumber="90"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00091" /><CodeLine lineNumber="91"><Highlight kind="comment">      /// A pointer to a Twine instance.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00092" /><CodeLine lineNumber="92"><Highlight kind="normal">      TwineKind,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00093" /><CodeLine lineNumber="93"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00094" /><CodeLine lineNumber="94"><Highlight kind="comment">      /// A pointer to a C string instance.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00095" /><CodeLine lineNumber="95"><Highlight kind="normal">      CStringKind,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00096" /><CodeLine lineNumber="96"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00097" /><CodeLine lineNumber="97"><Highlight kind="comment">      /// A pointer to an std::string instance.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00098" /><CodeLine lineNumber="98"><Highlight kind="normal">      StdStringKind,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00099" /><CodeLine lineNumber="99"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00100" /><CodeLine lineNumber="100"><Highlight kind="comment">      /// A Pointer and Length representation. Used for std::string&#95;view,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00101" /><CodeLine lineNumber="101"><Highlight kind="comment">      /// StringRef, and SmallString.  Can&#39;t use a StringRef here</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00102" /><CodeLine lineNumber="102"><Highlight kind="comment">      /// because they are not trivally constructible.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00103" /><CodeLine lineNumber="103"><Highlight kind="normal">      PtrAndLengthKind,</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00378" /><CodeLine lineNumber="378"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// FIXME: Unfortunately, to make sure this is as efficient as possible we</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00379" /><CodeLine lineNumber="379"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// need extra binary constructors from particular types. We can&#39;t rely on</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00381" /><CodeLine lineNumber="381"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// right thing. Yet.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00499" /><CodeLine lineNumber="499"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// This returns the twine as a single null terminated StringRef if it</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00501" /><CodeLine lineNumber="501"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// given SmallVector and a StringRef to the SmallVector&#39;s data is returned.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00502" /><CodeLine lineNumber="502"><Highlight kind="comment">    ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00503" /><CodeLine lineNumber="503"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// The returned StringRef&#39;s size does not include the null terminator.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00504" /><CodeLine lineNumber="504"><Highlight kind="normal">    <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/stringref">StringRef</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/twine/#a5d968bc337af0be1f18813553a046df6">toNullTerminatedStringRef</a>(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/smallvectorimpl">SmallVectorImpl&lt;char&gt;</a> &amp;Out) </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00505" /><CodeLine lineNumber="505"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00506" /><CodeLine lineNumber="506"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// Write the concatenated string represented by this twine to the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00507" /><CodeLine lineNumber="507"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// stream \\p OS.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00508" /><CodeLine lineNumber="508"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">void</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/twine/#a5879f1eb58da7b477f75f9a980ebf145">print</a>(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/raw-ostream">raw&#95;ostream</a> &amp;OS) </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00509" /><CodeLine lineNumber="509"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00510" /><CodeLine lineNumber="510"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// Dump the concatenated string represented by this twine to stderr.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00511" /><CodeLine lineNumber="511"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">void</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/twine/#a61bf259f7bf14d45f68e145f121e1891">dump</a>() </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00512" /><CodeLine lineNumber="512"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00513" /><CodeLine lineNumber="513"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// Write the representation of this twine to the stream \\p OS.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00514" /><CodeLine lineNumber="514"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">void</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/twine/#a8ee549d9c78d0c653646407ae1f09b88">printRepr</a>(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/raw-ostream">raw&#95;ostream</a> &amp;OS) </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00515" /><CodeLine lineNumber="515"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00516" /><CodeLine lineNumber="516"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// Dump the representation of this twine to stderr.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00517" /><CodeLine lineNumber="517"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">void</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/twine/#af3748b109893adeac3a84c62f072ffab">dumpRepr</a>() </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00518" /><CodeLine lineNumber="518"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00519" /><CodeLine lineNumber="519"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// @&#125;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00520" /><CodeLine lineNumber="520"><Highlight kind="normal">  &#125;;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00521" /><CodeLine lineNumber="521"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00522" /><CodeLine lineNumber="522"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// @name Twine Inline Implementations</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00523" /><CodeLine lineNumber="523"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// @&#123;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00524" /><CodeLine lineNumber="524"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00525" /><CodeLine lineNumber="525" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/twine/#a529bd775f25e1c6ea4a96b34a5d8bde6"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">inline</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> Twine <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/twine/#a529bd775f25e1c6ea4a96b34a5d8bde6">Twine::concat</a>(</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> Twine &amp;Suffix)</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword"> const </Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">&#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00526" /><CodeLine lineNumber="526"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Concatenation with null is null.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00527" /><CodeLine lineNumber="527"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (isNull() || Suffix.isNull())</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00528" /><CodeLine lineNumber="528"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">return</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/twine/#a04fc8d246b44aea58511a60ccf88b907">Twine</a>(NullKind);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00529" /><CodeLine lineNumber="529"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00530" /><CodeLine lineNumber="530"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Concatenation with empty yields the other side.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00531" /><CodeLine lineNumber="531"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (isEmpty())</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00532" /><CodeLine lineNumber="532"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">return</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> Suffix;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00533" /><CodeLine lineNumber="533"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (Suffix.isEmpty())</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00534" /><CodeLine lineNumber="534"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">return</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> &#42;</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">this</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00535" /><CodeLine lineNumber="535"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00536" /><CodeLine lineNumber="536"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Otherwise we need to create a new node, taking care to fold in unary</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00537" /><CodeLine lineNumber="537"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// twines.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00538" /><CodeLine lineNumber="538"><Highlight kind="normal">    Child NewLHS, NewRHS;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00539" /><CodeLine lineNumber="539"><Highlight kind="normal">    NewLHS.twine = </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">this</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00540" /><CodeLine lineNumber="540"><Highlight kind="normal">    NewRHS.twine = &amp;Suffix;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00541" /><CodeLine lineNumber="541"><Highlight kind="normal">    NodeKind NewLHSKind = TwineKind, NewRHSKind = TwineKind;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00542" /><CodeLine lineNumber="542"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (isUnary()) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00543" /><CodeLine lineNumber="543"><Highlight kind="normal">      NewLHS = <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/x86/x86partialreduction-cpp/#a9e1483f7215664a2315c53c3558d9a8d">LHS</a>;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00544" /><CodeLine lineNumber="544"><Highlight kind="normal">      NewLHSKind = getLHSKind();</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00545" /><CodeLine lineNumber="545"><Highlight kind="normal">    &#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00546" /><CodeLine lineNumber="546"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (Suffix.isUnary()) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00547" /><CodeLine lineNumber="547"><Highlight kind="normal">      NewRHS = Suffix.LHS;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00548" /><CodeLine lineNumber="548"><Highlight kind="normal">      NewRHSKind = Suffix.getLHSKind();</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00549" /><CodeLine lineNumber="549"><Highlight kind="normal">    &#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00550" /><CodeLine lineNumber="550"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00551" /><CodeLine lineNumber="551"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">return</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/twine/#a04fc8d246b44aea58511a60ccf88b907">Twine</a>(NewLHS, NewLHSKind, NewRHS, NewRHSKind);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00552" /><CodeLine lineNumber="552"><Highlight kind="normal">  &#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00553" /><CodeLine lineNumber="553"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00554" /><CodeLine lineNumber="554" lineLink="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a4443c9d3decc13b50e28950634dfeb9c"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">inline</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/twine">Twine</a> <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#ad7c8b5bd3872c6d5d4ba907eb030e78a">operator+</a>(</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/twine">Twine</a> &amp;<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/x86/x86partialreduction-cpp/#a9e1483f7215664a2315c53c3558d9a8d">LHS</a>, </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/twine">Twine</a> &amp;<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/x86/x86partialreduction-cpp/#a87b8bfbbe9d8f7146d7f20a5fb42efd0">RHS</a>) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
